body:
**What happened**:

After fixing golint failures under `test/e2e` (now still in progress), we need to put `gomega` for each `Expect()` and `HaveOccurred()`.
Then very common error checking code has become like:

`gomega.Expect(err).NotTo(gomega.HaveOccurred())`

We can replace this code with `framework.ExpectNoError(err)` which is more readable and easy to be understood what the code does.

Now we have following e2e test directories which can be replaced:
( - [x] shows done)
- [x] test/e2e (@oomichi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77693)
- [x] test/e2e/apimachinery (@draveness https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77708)
- [x] test/e2e/apps (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77894)
- [x] test/e2e/auth (@oomichi)
- [x] test/e2e/autoscaling (@s-ito-ts)
- [x] test/e2e/common (@oomichi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/78042)
- [x] test/e2e/framework/providers/gce
- [x] test/e2e/lifecycle (@atoato88 https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77649)
- [x] test/e2e/lifecycle/bootstrap (@atoato88 https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77754)
- [x] test/e2e/network (@k-toyoda-pi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77901 https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77909)
- [x] test/e2e/node (@s-ito-ts https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77902)
- [x] test/e2e/instrumentation (@draveness)
- [x] test/e2e/kubectl (@draveness)
- [x] test/e2e/scalability (@oomichi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77890)
- [x] test/e2e/scheduling (@oomichi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77890)
- [x] test/e2e/servicecatalog
- [x] e2e/storage/vsphere (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/78021)
- [x] test/e2e/ui (@draveness)
- [x] test/e2e/upgrades/apps (@draveness https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77627)
- [x] test/e2e/upgrades (@oomichi https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77955)
- [x] test/e2e/upgrades/storage (@draveness)
- [x] test/e2e/windows (@draveness)

After finishing all the above, we need to add the checking script to the CI system for blocking PRs which contain this issue:

- [ ] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77612

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.
labels.name: kind/cleanup

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: Use framework.ExpectNoError() for e2e tests
